title: Articles of Confederation Congress could not tax

content.question: Under the Articles of Confederation, which of the following were true? I. Congress could not tax the states directly. II. The executive branch of government exercised more power than Congress. III. Congress was a unicameral body. IV. States were represented in Congress proportionally according to population.

topic.text: 1.4: Challenges of the Articles of Confederation

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
